headline: Constitutively expressed gene shows stage-specific regulation and mRNA degradation sensitivity
one_paragraph_summary:
This Trypanosoma brucei gene exhibits constitutive moderate-to-high expression across most life cycle stages and experimental conditions, typically ranging from 20-80 TPM. The gene shows consistent downregulation patterns in mRNA degradation experiments and stage-specific differences with higher expression in procyclic forms compared to bloodstream forms in most datasets.
  • Robust response to mRNA degradation pathways regardless of specific conditions
  • Preferential expression in insect-stage parasites
  • Sensitivity to RNA helicase DHH1 mutations
  • Stable expression during vector development
The gene's consistent expression levels and degradation sensitivity suggest it may encode a constitutively required protein with post-transcriptional regulation mechanisms.

topics.headline: Gene shows robust downregulation during mRNA degradation across multiple pathways
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene consistently decreases 3-8 fold during mRNA degradation experiments regardless of tetracycline treatment, XRNA knockout status, or RNA sample preparation method.

topics.headline: DHH1 RNA helicase mutant specifically downregulates gene expression
topics.one_sentence_summary: Expression decreases 2.6-fold when DHH1 DEAD:DQAD mutant is expressed compared to minimal change with wild-type DHH1 overexpression.

topics.headline: Higher expression in procyclic forms indicates life cycle stage-specific regulation
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene shows consistently higher expression in insect-stage procyclic forms compared to mammalian bloodstream forms across multiple experimental conditions.
